definition: to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: Absorption is also dependent upon air flow rates and the partial pressure of the gases in the inspired air.
sentences.chinese: 吸收也取決於空氣流速和吸入空氣中的氣體分壓。

sentences.english: Conclusions Osteoclast-mediated bone resorption was inhibited by the bisphosphonate administration.
sentences.chinese: 結論雙膦酸鹽對破骨細胞性骨吸收有明顯的抑制作用。

sentences.english: It attracted many thousands of visitors from all levels of society.
sentences.chinese: 水晶宮曾吸收了社會各階級的瞻仰者駐足欣賞。

sentences.english: Moreover, the existence of absorbing sets was achieved in the non-homogeneous case.
sentences.chinese: 進而，也得到了對非齊次問題吸收集的存在性。

sentences.english: The influence of absorbing type refrigerating machine upon enorgysaving rate of the triplex cogeneration system to be very little.
sentences.chinese: 吸收式製冷機對三聯產系統節能率的影響很小。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To investigate the absorption characteristics and mechanism of bergenin in rat intestine.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究巖白菜素在大鼠腸道中的吸收機理。

sentences.english: Spread abundant quantities of cream and massage carefully until absorbed.
sentences.chinese: 塗抹足量的霜，並且仔細按摩，直至完全吸收。

sentences.english: Bottle-feeding lets me know how much nutrition the baby has had.
sentences.chinese: 瓶喂使我知道寶寶到底吸收了多少營養。

sentences.english: Once the water reaches saturation , it can't take anymore.
sentences.chinese: 當達到飽和時，水將無法吸收更多的砂糖。

sentences.english: The best, most ideal situation is that we absorb Bible doctrine, and learn the principles of Biblical apologetics, during our secondary school years.
sentences.chinese: 我們在中學時期就充分吸收《聖經》教義和護教學。

sentences.english: Black carbon absorbs solar radiation, warming the atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 炭黑吸收陽光輻射，讓大氣增溫。

sentences.english: In your experience, what benefits has recruitment brought to your club?
sentences.chinese: 在你經驗中，於貴社吸收新社員時有何益處？

sentences.english: In addition, MRP2 also influences the complicated absorption process of the traditional Chinese medicine, in particul…
sentences.chinese: 此外，MRP2還影響着中藥成分的腸吸收過程。

sentences.english: A lack of sleep can interfere with your ability to assimilate new information.
sentences.chinese: 缺少睡眠能夠影響你吸收新信息的能力。

sentences.english: Plants take up CO2 and store carbon in their biomasses.
sentences.chinese: 植物吸收二氧化碳並存儲在植物生物量中。

sentences.english: Lounge patrons desperately wanted to imbibe the essence of all this.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧的老主顧們極欲將全部精華吸收殆盡。

definition: to adhere to a surface/to absorb/to draw in/(fig.) to attract/(chemistry) adsorption
to absorb/to draw (a lesson, insight etc)/to assimilate
to absorb (nutrients etc)/to assimilate/intake/to take a photograph of (a scene)
best feature/most important part of an object/quintessence/essence/soul
to take in/to absorb/to admit/to accept
(of soil etc) to wash away/to be eroded/(fig.) (of talented staff, followers of a religious faith, investment funds etc) to go elsewhere/to fail to be retained
